page.title: 15Geology of Crathie
page.content:
Most of this area is covered by glacial moraine on the hills with peat at Monaltrie Moss and alluvial light soils on the valley floor. Reworked river terraces are visible on the flats below Crathie Church. The bedrock is of Dalradian quartzite, black and grey schists and limestone.
There are limestone quarries to be found near most of the surviving farms, exploiting the grey Dalradian limestone. The largest of these is behind Crathie Kirk and its use continued into the 1930's.
The valley soils are very light and drain quickly.
